standard_bio: Hello! I am Prabhat Racherla, a passionate and detail-oriented Backend Engineer with a robust history of designing, developing, and deploying scalable, high-performance server-side applications. My core preference lies with Python, but I have professionally worked with and adapted to Perl, Scala, and C# when project needs required it. My expertise spans cloud infrastructure, microservices architecture, and databases.

personal_insights.title: A Digital Statement
personal_insights.content: As a seasoned Backend Engineer, my desire for a personal website was long hindered by a simple knowledge gap: frontend development. Discovering the Reflex framework and harnessing the capability of AI for implementation—was the game-changer. This portfolio is also a deliberate rejection of the 'one-page resume' tyranny and the proliferation of paid resume-builder services. It's was long due on my side to move beyond font size 9 single page resume, to showcase the full, unconstrained breadth of one's imagination and best work.

personal_insights.title: Wealth Architecture
personal_insights.content: RecentlI've recently started prioritizing genuine wealth creation, inspired by foundational financial texts. Reading books like The Richest Man in Babylon, The Psychology of Money, and Rich Dad Poor Dad has been eye-opening. The core lesson is clear: relying solely on the intense '996' work culture primarily serves to maximize the wealth of C-suite executives, often leaving me, the dedicated employee, perpetually chasing my own financial and life stability. My goal now is to establish a working relationship—whether as an employee or a freelancer—that is mutually beneficial and values my contribution as a true partner, not just a resource.

personal_insights.title: The Value of Decency
personal_insights.content: I value a high-paying job, but it is utterly secondary to foundational human dignity: a stress-free commute, breathable air, guaranteed drinking water in summer, zero water-logging in the rains, and freedom from the 'Rental Mafia.' No exorbitant salary in a poorly managed city can compel me to compromise on this baseline decency. When you have the opportunity and means to build multiple income streams, you deserve to live as a human, not as a slave to location or circumstance.

footnote.content: PS: And yes, I was the brain, and my AI was the highly-paid, bug-fixing, problem-solver, that did 996. I didn't feel any shame in exploiting it to get this built, while I sipped scotch
